item.title: ‘Misogynist’: Abbott under fire in UK
item.description: Former Australian prime minister Tony Abbott has been labelled a “misogynist” and a “sexist” on British morning television.

item.title: Man charged over jogger stabbing
item.description: A man has been charged after a woman was allegedly stabbed in broad daylight while jogging in Melbourne’s inner north.

item.title: Grave fears for missing 11yo girl
item.description: An 11-year-old girl has not been seen for three days after vanishing from her Bathurst home, in the NSW Central Tablelands.

item.title: Accused ‘serial flasher’ charged
item.description: A man accused of repeatedly stalking and intimidating women on Sydney’s Northern Beaches over the last three years has been charged with 39 offences.

item.title: Retrial ordered for accused Vic rapist
item.description: A Victorian man will face a new trial for an alleged rape after appeal judges found there was a miscarriage of justice in his original court case.

item.title: Sydney wants NBL hubs as league looks elsewhere
item.description: Adelaide, Perth, New Zealand and Victoria are being considered as hub locations to open the 2020-21 NBL but the NSW government doesn’t want Sydney to be snubbed.

item.title: Love affair claims led to fatal punch attack
item.description: A Melbourne man punched his friend in the head, dragged him off a road and left him to die under a shrub over claims of a love affair.

item.title: Jogger attacker remains on loose
item.description: A man who attacked a jogger in Melbourne remains on the loose after a suspect was arrested then released without charge.

item.title: ‘No timetable’ on WA border
item.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan is refusing to put a time frame on reopening the border, noting other states have “chopped and changed” their policies during the ongoing pandemic.

item.title: Jobs to go at Opera Australia
item.description: Opera Australia is axing jobs, blaming the “devastating” impact of COVID-19.
